Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ceratoxin (Snake venom-like waprin; Pro-rich domain; Cys-rich domain; modular design; UCSS1a; possible 4S=S, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: It showed 45% sequence similarity withsnake Omwaprin, AP1589, which contains a (whey acidic domain) WAP domain.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: Cer/pET-32a(+) plasmid, Rosetta-gami (DE3), 0.8 mM IPTG induction, fusion expression, Ni2+ affinity chromatography/HPLC purification.Activity: recombinant peptide is active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 1.5 ug/ml), E.coli ATCC 25922 (MIC >250 ug/ml), B. subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 5.9 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC 20032 (MIC 5.9 ug/ml).Toxicity: human RBC: 2% hemolysis at 400 ug/ml (rabbit RBC 2.6% hemolysis), little hemo.lytic. Updated 4/2024
Literature Information.Author: Liu D, Wang Y, Wei L, Ye H, Liu H, Wang L, Liu R, Li D, Lai R.2012
Literature Information.Title: Snake venom-like waprin from the frog of Ceratophrys calcarata contains antimicrobial function.
